Package io.dvlopt.linux.epoll

Class Epoll

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dvlopt.linux.epoll.Epoll
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class Epoll
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    API for using epoll.

    It is quite close to the native API but wrapped in a java idiomatic interface.

    See Also:
    Epoll man pages

      • wait

        public int wait​(EpollEvent event)
         throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Waits for an event to happen.
        Parameters:
        event - An EpollEvent that will be filled when something happens.
        Returns:
        0 if nothing happened before unblocking, 1 if something did.
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - In case of failure.
        See Also:
        wait(io.dvlopt.linux.epoll.EpollEvent,int)

      • wait

        public int wait​(EpollEvent event,
                int timeout)
         throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Waits for an event to happen within the given timeout.

        The given EpollEvent will be filled by the kernel to describe the type of event that happened and write back the user data.

        Parameters:
        event - An EpollEvent that will be filled when something happens.
        timeout - How many milliseconds at least should we wait. A timeout of -1 will block forever until something happens.
        Returns:
        0 if nothing happened before the timeout elapsed, 1 if something did.
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - In case of failure.

      • wait

        public int wait​(EpollEvents events)
         throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Wait for events to happen (at most the size of events).

        The given EpollEvents will be filled by the kernel to describe the type of event that happened and write back the user data.

        Parameters:
        events - EpollEvents that will be filled when something happens.
        Returns:
        Number describing how many events happened before the timeout elapsed. This function unblocks as soon as something happens but sometimes, several events can happen at once.
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - In case of failure.
        See Also:
        wait(io.dvlopt.linux.epoll.EpollEvents,int)

      • wait

        public int wait​(EpollEvents events,
                int timeout)
         throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Wait for events to happen (at most the size of events) within the given timeout.

        The given EpollEvents will be filled by the kernel to describe the type of event that happened and write back the user data.

        Parameters:
        events - EpollEvents that will be filled when something happens.
        timeout - How many milliseconds at least should we wait. A timeout of -1 will block forever until something happens.
        Returns:
        Number describing how many events happened before the timeout elapsed. This function unblocks as soon as something happens but sometimes, several events can happen at once.
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - In case of failure.
